Ingredients: 6 large russet potatoes, peeled, cut into 1/4 inch thick sticks, Canola oil, Salt, 1 1/2lbs cheese curds, (For Gravy-->) 1tbsp cornstarch, 1tbsp water, 3tbsp unsalted butter, 1/2cup unbleached all-purpose flour, 1 clove garlic finely chopped, 1 can(10oz) chicken broth undiluted, pepper
Directions: Place a large bowl of potatoes submerged in cold water for 30min to 24hours.  Heat oil in deep fryer to 170C and put a wire rack on baking tray.  Drain and pat dry potatoes.  Place in fryer basket.  Fry for 2min.  Remove potatoes and put on wire rack to cool.  Raise fryer temp to 180C.  Fry the fries a second time for 2-4 minutes.  When they are golden brown, place on paper towels to drain.  Season with salt and keep warm in oven until ready to serve.  In a small bowl dissolve cornstarch in water.  Place saucepan over medium-low heat.  Melt butter and add flour and while constantly stirring cook for five minutes until golden brown.  Add garlic and cook for 30min.  Pour in broth and bring to a boil, constantly stirring.  Last add cornstarch and simmer for 3-5min until broth thickens, then season with pepper.  Serve fries with cheese and gravy.

Ingredients: 1 Packaged Pizza Dough, 1/4 cup tomato sauce, 1 1/2 cups grated mozzarella, 150g pineapple(cut into 1/4inch slices), 60g sliced ham(cut into 1 1/2 pieces)
Directions: Preheat oven to 450F.  Sprinkle bottom of a 51inch pizza pan with cornmeal.  Put dough on lightly floured worktop and roll it out to 14 inch circle.  Place cirlce of dough into pan.  Coat the dough with tomato sauce, then sprinkle it with mozzarella and dot with pineapple slices and pieces of ham.  Bake for 20min.

Ingredients: 1 box of Kraft Dinner
Directions: Fill pot with 3-4 cups of water(about twice the serving size of the pasta).  Add a teaspoon of salt.  Bring water to a boil.  Add Noodles to boiling water.  Boil for 6-8min until noodles are soft and chewy.  Drain noodles.  Prepare cheese sauce as directed.  Either by adding milk and margarine/butter or straight from the pouch.  Stir drained noodles together with cheese sauce until thoroughly mixed.

Ingredients: (Bottom)FIRST LAYER: 1/2 cup unsalted butter, 1/4 cup sugar, 5tbsp cocao, 1 egg beaten, 1 3/4 cups graham wafer crumbs, 1/2 cup finely chopped almonds, 1 cup coconut. SECOND LAYER: 1/2 cup unsalted butter, 2 tbsp + 2tsp cream, 2 tbsp vanilla custard powder, 2 cups icing sugar.  (Top)THIRD LAYER: 4oz semi-sweet chocolate, 2tbsp unsalted butter.
Directions: (Bottom)FIRST LAYER: Add the butter, sugar and the cocoa to a bain-marie and cook until melted and combined.  Whisk the egg and add to the bain-marie.  Cook constantly stirring until thickened.  Take off heat.  Stir in the graham wafer crumbs, the coconut, and the nuts.  Press the mass into an ungreased 8x8 inch pan.  MIDDLE LAYER: Add butter, cream, vanilla custard powder and the icing sugar to a large bowl.  Beat with mixer until creamed and light.  Spread over the bottom layer.  THIRD LAYER: Add the chocolate and the butter to a saucepan.  Melt over very low heat, stirring constantly.  Let cool down.  Once cooled but pourable, spread over the second layer.  Refrigerate until chilled and hard, then cut into 24 bars.

Ingredients: 1 1/2lbs of lean, grass-fed shoulder roast.  Fresh or frozen wild blueberries.  Grass-fed bison or beef kidney fat, leaf fat, suet, or tallow.
Directions: Let meat firm up in the freezer, then slice thin.  After adding liberal amounts of salt and pepper, set oven to lowest possible temperature(around 150 degrees) lay out strips of meat directly onto a rack.  Keep oven door slightly open to prevent buildup.  Put handful of frozen wild blueberries on small oven pan to dry out the meat.  Let the meat dry out for about 15hours, or until it takes on a crispy jerky characteristic that breaks apart easily.  Pulverize the jerky in the food processor or blender until it becomes powder.  Do the same for the blueberries, pulverize into powder.  Now render the fat.  Grass-fed bison kidney fat works.  Put about half a pound of that into a cast iron pan and cooked it slowly over super-low heat.  When fat stops bubling, the rendering is done.  Use strainer, you just want pure liquid fat.  Mix the meat and the berry powder together.  Then slowly add the hot liquid fat.  Make sure fat soaks into powder.  If you poured too much fat too quickly, you can add a bit of almond meal to firm it up.  Once it firms, cut it into bars or roll it into bars.

Ingredients: DONAIR SAUCE: 2/3 Cup sweetened condensed milk, 1/4 cup white vinegar, 1/2tsp garlic powder.  GARLIC FINGERS: 1 pkg Pizza dough, 1tbsp garlic butter melted, 2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese, 2tbsp cornmeal flour to dust pan.
Directions: DONAIR SAUCE: Combine sweetened condensed milk with vinegar and garlic powder.  GARLIC FINGERS: Preheat oven to 450F.  Dust a 15 inch pan with cornmeal.  Turn out dough onto lightly floured surface.  Roll dough into a 14 inch cirlce.  Transfer to pan.  Brush garlic butter evenly over dough.  Sprinkle with cheese.  Bake until cheese and crust are golden brown(15 min).  Cut into 2 inch strips.  Serve with donair sauce.

Ingredients: 2 cans Wild Pacific Pink or Sockeye Salmon, 2cups Mashed potatoes, 1 egg, 3tbsp Chopped onion, 1 clove garlic minced, 1tbsp butter, 1tsp dried thyme, Salt and pepper to taste, 1 box Two-crust pie refrigerated and uncooked.
Directions: Preheat oven to 220C.  Thoroughly mix the salmon with the mashed potatoes and egg.  Saute onions and garlic in butter.  Add thyme, salt and pepper to taste.  Stir this into salmon mixture.  Ease the pie crust dough into the pie plate without stretching it.  Pour in the mixture evenly.  Cover with second crust.  Seal the two crusts together by pinching the edges.  Make slits on top crust.  Bake for 10 minutes.  Reduce temperature to 180C and back for additional 30 minutes.  Remove from oven, cut and serve hot, with mixed greens if preferred.

Ingredients: MASHED POTATOES: 2lbs potatoes peeled and quartered, 1/3 milk, 1tbsp salted butter, 3/4 tsp salt, 1/4 garlic powder, 1/8 ground black pepper. FOR DISH: 1tbsp salted butter, 1 onion diced, 1lb ground beef(90% lean), 1tsp paprika, 1tsp thyme, 3/4 tsp salt, 2 sweet corn.
Directions: Preheat oven to 350F.  Put peeled and quartered potatoes into a medium soup pot and cover with water.  Bring to a boil and simmer for 15-20min until the potatoes are very tender.  Drain and add the milk, 1tbsp butter, 3/4 tsp salt, garlic powder, and black pepper.  Beat using and electric hand mixer to achieve very smooth and fluffy mashed potatoes.  In a large skillet, heat 1tbsp butter.  Add the diced onion and saute over medium-high heat until the onions are golden, 3-5 minutes.  Add the ground beef and brown the beef until it is cooked through.  Add the paprika, thyme and salt.  Pour the onion and beef mixture into the bottom of a greased 8x8 baking dish.  Evenly distribute the corn over the meat.  Finally dollop the potatoes over the corn.  Spreading them to create an even top crust.  Place dish in oven and bake for 30-40 minutes.  Until top is golden brown.

Ingredients: 1lb ground beef, 2cups mozzarella cheese, 1/2lb spaghetti, 1 jar chunky garden vegetable spaghetti sauce, 1/2 pepperoni, cooking spray.
Directions: Boil the spaghetti in water.  Set aside and let cool for a bit.  Brown the ground beef until well-cooked and then stir in the sauce.  Let simmer for about 10 minutes.  Spray a 9 by 12 glass casserole dish with cooking spray.  Spread a little of the sauce mixture on the bottom of the pan and then top with a layer of spaghetti.  Add another thicker layer of sauce, followed by a layer of pepperoni and a layer of cheese.  Repeat until you are out of sauce, ending with a layer of cheese.  Bake in a 350 degree oven about 25 minutes or until the cheese is completely melted and bubbling.

Ingredients: 2tbsp margarine, 2 onions chopped, 4 quarts chicken broth, 4 pounds boneless skinless chicken breasts, 10 pounds potatoes peeled and diced, 2tbsp salt, 1tbsp ground black pepper.
Directions: Preheat oven to 400F.  Heat margarine in skillet over medium heat.  Stir in onion.  Cook and stir until onion has softened and turn translucent about 5 min.  Reduce heat to low and continue to cook and stir until onion is very tender and dark brown(about 40min).  Bring chicken broth to a boil in a large pot.  Stir in chicken breasts, reduce heat, and simmer until chicken is no longer pink at the center(about 20min)  Remove from heat.  Remove chicken breasts to a plate using a slotted spoon.  Preserve broth.  Juice potaotes with an electric juicer.  Place dry potato flesh into a bowl and discard juice.  Stir salt and pepper into potatoes.  Stir in enough reserved broth to make the mixture the consistency of oatmeal.  Set remaining broth aside.  Spread half of potato mixture evenly into the prepared pan. Lay cooked chicken breast evenly over potatoes.  Scatter caramelized onion evenly over chicken.  Spread remaining potato mixture over onions and chicken to cover.  Bake in preheated oven until golden brown(about 1hour).  Reheat chicken broth.  Pour over individual servings as desired.

Ingredients: 2 hard bread cakes spit horizontally, 1 pound salt cod steaks skinned and cut into 1/2inch strips, 1tsp salt, 1/2 pound fatback diced.
Directions: Place hard bread into a pot.  Cover bread with several inches of cool water and place a lid on the pot.  Soak 8 hours overnight.  Rinse salt cod under running cool water.  Place into pot.  Cover fish with several inches of cold water.  Place a lid on the pot and soak in refrigerator 8 hours overnight.  Add salt to soaked bread and bring just to a simmer over medium-low heat and simmer for 2min.  Drain immediately and cover to keep warm  Drain fish and cover with fresh water.  Bring to a boil.  Cook until fish is opaque and flakes easily with a fork(about 20min).  Drain fish.  Remove bones.  Stir fish into prepared hard bread.  Cook and stir fatback in a frying pan over medium heat until golden brown(about 10min).  Pour fatback and drippings over fish and bread mixture.  Stir gently to combine and serve immediately.

Ingredients: 1.2kg of freshly ground chuck, 1tbsp of onion powder, 1tsp salt, 1tsp freshly ground black pepper, 12 slices of American cheese, 6 large burger buns, lettuce, onions sliced, tomatoes sliced, ketchup, pickles sliced.
Directions: In a large bowl gently mix ground beef and onion powder, then shape into 6 patties that are slightly larger than your hamburger buns and have a dent in the center.  Heat your grill, pan, or skillet over high heat.  Season the patties liberally with salt and pepper, then place on grill to cook.  Cook for about two minutes until the crust on the bottom has formed.  Flip the burgers once you can lift them up easily then add two cheese slices to each.  Cook for another 2-3 minutes.  Remove from the grill and transfer into buns.  Add the desired garnishings and condiments like lettuce, onions, tomatoes, ketchup and then serve.

Ingredients: 1tbsp salted butter, 2 slices cheddar, monterey jack or swiss cheese, 2 slices country white bread.
Directions: First assemble the sandwich and press it slightly to hold.  Melt a tablespoon of butter over medium-low heat then place the sandwich in the pan.  Cook each side for 3-5min until golden.

Ingredients: 1tsp vegetable oil, 1 (4lb) pork shoulder roast, 1cup barbeque sauce, 1/2 cup apple cider vinegar, 1/2cup chicken broth, 1/4 cup light brown sugar, 1tbsp prepared yellow mustard, 1tbsp Worcestershire sauce, 1tbsp chili powder, 1 extra large onion chopped, 2 large cloves garlic crushed, 1 1/2 teaspoons dried thyme, 8 hamburger buns split, 2tbsp butter.
Directions: Pour the vegetable oil into the bottom of slow cooker.  Place the pork roast into the slow cooker.  Pour in the barbecue sauce, apple cider vinegar, and chicken broth.  Stir in the brown sugar, yellow mustard, Worcestershire sauce, chili powder, onion, garlic, and thyme.  Cover and cook on high until the roast shreds easily with a fork.  5 to 6 hours.  Remove the roast from the slow cooker and shred the meat using two forks.  Return the shredded pork to the slow cooker and stir the meat into the juices.  Spread the inside of both halves of hamburger buns with butter.  Toast the buns butter side down in a skillet over medium heat until golden brown.  Spoon pork into the toasted buns.

Ingredients: 1/2lb bacon, 8 slices white bread, 8 lettuce leaves, 8 slices of ripe tomatoes, 8tbsp mayonnaise.
Directions: Prepare the bacon first.  Cook it so it becomes crispy and then place on some paper towels to drain.  Next toast the bread and spread a tablespoon of mayonnaise on each slice.  Now assemble the sandwiches in the following order.  Toast with mayonnaise side up.  1 lettuce leaf, 2 slices of tomato, 3 bacon slices, 1 lettuce leaf, toast with mayonnaise side down.  This will make 4 sandwiches.

Ingredients: 2 boneless skinless chicken breasts, 1tsp salt, 1/2tsp parsley flakes, 1/2tsp of oregano, 1/4tsp onion powder, 1/4tsp pepper, 2 eggs beaten, 1cup flour, 1.5cups oil for frying.  HONEY MUSTARD SAUCE: 1tbsp of honey + 1tbsp of mustard.  SPICY HONEY MUSTARD SAUCE: 1tbsp of honey + 1tsp mustard + few dashes of hot sauce
Directions: Cube the chicken and grind it in a food processor until meat turns into a paste.  Transfer the meat slurry into a bowl, season with salt, parsley, oregano, onion powder, pepper and mix.  Prepare the flour and eggs to coat the meat.  Place the flour onto a plate and whisk the eggs in a small bowl.  Divide the chicken slurry into 34 ping pong ball-sized balls.  Dip each ball of chicken into flour then in eggs, then in flour once again.  Once breaded, to make a nugget, flatten each ball by pressing down on it.  Place as many nuggets in oil as possible and fry them on each side for about 4-5min or until golden.  As each nugget is done, transfer it to a paper-towel lined plate.

Ingredients: 1/3cup mayonnaise, 1 large egg beaten, 2tbsp Dijon mustard, 2tsp Worcestershire sauce, 1/2tsp hot sauce, kosher salt, freshly ground black pepper, 1lb jumbo lump crabmeat, 3/4cup panko bread crumbs, 2tbsp freshly chopped parsley, canola oil for frying, lemon wedges, tartar sauce.
Directions: In small bowl whisk together mayo, egg, dijon mustard, Worcestershire, and hot sauce, and season with salt and pepper.  In a medium bowl stir together crabmeat, panko, and parsley.  Fold in mayo mixture then form into 8 patties.  In a large skillet over medium-high heat, coat pan with oil and heat until shimmering.  Add crab cakes and cook, in batches, until golden and crispy.  3-5min per side.  Serve with lemon and tartar sauce.

Ingredients: 2 1/2lbs fresh heads on shrimp, 1/2 chicken, 6 live crabs, 4tbsp butter, 4tbsp flour, 1 1/2 large onions chopped, 1 green pepper chopped, 3 scallions with tops chopped, 2 cloves garlic minced, 1/2 cup chopped celery, 1 1/2 pound fresh okra chopped, 1/4 pound country ham diced, 2 strips bacon, 1/2 pound of stewing beef, 2 dozen oysters and their liquor, 1 small ham bone, 2 large tomatoes peeled and diced, 1 bay leaf, 1/2 tsp thyme, pinch of cayenne, 1/2 tsp ground black pepper, 3 quarts stock or watter, 2tbsp salt.
Directions: Boil shrimp in salted water for 5min then drain, peel, and devein the shrimp.  Set aside shrimp and shrimp water for later.  Crush shrimp heads and shells in a pot, transfer to shrimp water and boil at full rolling boil for 15min.  Strain liquid and set aside.  Cook chicken by boiling it in salted water, then remove and dice the skin, and also, remove the meat from the bones.  Using the flour and oil make a dark roux in a big skillet and proceed by sauteing the onions, green peppers, scallions, and garlic and celery until soft and translucent.  Next, add the okra and cook until it softens.  Transfer the mixture into a large stew pot to which you add all the previously prepared: shrimp water, chicken stock, chicken meat and skin.  While you're doing this the heat under the pot should not be on.  Fry the bacon and the diced country ham in a clean skillet until browned.  Drain and crumble the bacon, then together with ham add to the stew pot.  Place the washed live crabs in a pot, cover them with boiling water and cook for 20 min.  When cooked, transfer the crab water to the stew pot as well as the large claws that you've broken off.  Add as well the crab fat that you've scraped from the outer shell and proceed by removing the dead man's fingers, small claws and apron.  Crush the crab shells and boil them in water for 15 minutes, strain, then add to the stew pot.  Halve the remaining crabs by breaking them and together with oyster liquid add to the stew pot.  Finish by adding tomatoes, ham bone, and all the seasonings.  If the liquid is not about two inches over all the ingredients, add more, be it chicken stock, shrimp stock, oyster liquor, crab stock or just water.  Now turn the heat on the stove and let it simmer for 1 1/2 to 2 hours while occasionally stirring.  Ten minutes before serving add the oysters and shrimp, taste and add salt if needed.  Serve over a bowl of rice.

Ingredients: 1lb boneless skinless chicken breasts cut into 1 inch cubes, 1/2 pound andouille sausage diced, 1 can diced tomatoes, 1 medium onion chopped, 1 green bell pepper seeded and chopped, 1 stalk celery chopped, 1 cup reduced-sodium chicken broth, 2 teaspoons dried oregano, 2 teaspoons Cajun or Creole seasoning, 1tsp hot sauce, 2 bay leaves, 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme, 1lb frozen peeled and cooked shrimp thawed, 2 cups cooked rice.
Directions: You will need a slow cooker in which you will combine the sausage, tomatoes, chicken, green pepper, onion, and celery.  Pour in the chicken broth and stir in the spices: thyme, Cajun seasoning, bay leaves, hot sauce, and oregano.  Cover the cooker and set it to cook on low for 7 hours or 3 hours on high.  When the dish is cooked, incorporate the thawed shrimp, cover and leave to cook for five minutes until heated through.  Remove the bay leaves and serve with cooked rice.

Ingredients: 1 cup fresh breadcrumbs, 1/3 cup whole milk, 1 medium onion, 1 celery stalk, 4 garlic cloves, 2tbsp vegetable oil, 2 1/4tsp kosher salt divided, 1 1/2tsp freshly ground black pepper divided, 3tbsp Worcestershire sauce, 1 1/2lb ground beef chuck(preferably 20% fat), 1/2lb ground pork, 2 large eggs, 1/2cup ketchup.
Directions: Preheat oven to 350F and adjust the rack to a central position.  In a large bowl, soak breadcrumbs in milk.  Line a baking dish with foil.  Finely chop the onion, celery, and garlic by hand or in a food processor.  Take a large skillet, place it over medium heat and heat the oil.  Add onion, celery, and garlic with 1tsp salt and 1/2tsp pepper and cook for 5-7min, stirring occasionally and then remove from heat.  Mix in the Worcestershire sauce, and transfer this mixture to bowl containing the soaked breadcrumbs.  Now, add beef, pork, eggs, 1/4cup ketchup, and and remaining salt and pepper.  Combine using your hands.  Form a meatloaf on a prepared baking sheet: it should be about 5-inches wide and well-packed.  Apply the remaining 1/4cup ketchup on the top using a brush.  Bake for 60-75min.  The meatloaf is ready when the thermometer insterted in the center reads 155F.  Leave the meatloaf to rest for 15min and then slice.  Serve with additional ketchup.

Ingredients: 2 1/4 cups drained sauerkraut, 1/4 cup chopped sweet onion, 3tbsp chopped parsley, 3/4 creamy Russian dressing, 16 slices rye bread, 3/4lb sliced corned beef, 3/4lb sliced Swiss cheese, Butter or margarine softened.
Directions: Toss together sauerkraut, onion and parsley, then spread each slice of bread with Russian dressing.  Top the eight bread slices with corned beef, followed by cheese and sauerkraut.  Lastly, cover with the eight remaining slices.  Spread a light coating of butter on both sides of the sandwiches then grill them in a skillet on a griddle until the cheese melts and the bread is toasted and golden in color.

Ingredients: 4 ears corn shucked, Butter for serving, kosher salt.
Directions: Preheat grill to high and heat for 10min.  Add corn and cook, turning often until charred all over, about 10min.  Spread butter over warm corn and season with salt.

Ingredients: 1lb skinless boneless chicken breast halves cubed, 1 cup sliced carrots, 1 cup frozen green peas, 1/2 cup sliced celery, 1/3 cup butter, 1/3 cup chopped onion, 1/3 cup all-purpose flour, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, 1/4 teaspoon celery seed, 1 3/4 cups chicken broth, 2/3 cup milk, 2 (9 inch) unbaked pie crusts
Directions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.  In a saucepan, combine chicken, carrots, peas, and celery.  Add water to cover and boil for 15min.  Remove from heat, drain and set aside.  In the saucepan over medium heat, cook onions in butter until soft and translucent.  Stir in flour, salt, pepper, and celery seed.  Slowly stir in chicken broth and milk.  Simmer over medium-low heat until thick.  Remove from heat and set aside.  Place the chicken mixture in bottom pie crust.  Pour hot liquid mixture over.  Cover with top crust, seal edges, and cut away excess dough.  Make several small slits in the top to allow steam to escape.  Bake in the preheated oven for 30-35min or until pastry is golden brown and filling is bubbly.  Cool for 10min before serving.

Ingredients: 1/4 cup brown sugar, 2tbsp chili powder, Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, 1tsp dried oregano, 1/2 tsp cayenne pepper, 1/2 tsp garlic powder, 1/2 tsp onion powder, 2 racks baby back ribs, 1 cup low-sodium chicken broth, 2 tbsp apple cider vinegar, 1 cup barbecue sauce.
Directions: Combine brown sugar, chili powder, 1 tbsp salt, 1 tsp black pepper, the oregano, cayenne, garlic powder and onion powder in a small bowl and rub the mixture on both sides of the ribs.  Cover and refrigerate 1 hour or overnight.  Preheat the oven 250 degrees F.  In a roasting pan, combine the broth and vinegar.  Add the ribs to the pan.  Cover with foil and tightly seal.  Bake 2 hours.  Remove the ribs from the pan and place them on a platter.  Pour the liquid form the pan into a saucepan and bring to a boil.  Lower the heat to a simmer and cook until reduced by half.  Add the barbecue sauce.  Preheat an outdoor grill to medium heat.  Put the ribs on the grill and cook about 5min on each side, until browned and slightly charred.  Cut the ribs between the ones and toss them in a large bowl with the sauce.  Serve hot.

Ingredients: 1 2-3lb beef chuck roast, kosher or sea salt and freshly ground black pepper, 4tbsp olive oil, 1 large yellow onion diced, 3 garlic cloves minced, 1tsp chopped fresh rosemary, 1tsp chopped fresh thyme, 1 cup medium-bodies red wine, 4 cups beef stock, 2 tbsp tomato paste, 3 large carrots peeled and cut into 2 inch pieces, 3 celery ribs cut into 2 inch pieces, 2 cups pearl onions ends removed and peeled, 1 bay leaf whole, 2 sprigs fresh rosemary, 2 sprigs fresh thyme.
Directions: Before you start prepping the meat, place the oven rack in the lower half of the oven and then set it to 350F.  Pat dry the meat, season it generously with salt and pepper.  Heat two tablespoons of olive oil in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat, then brown the meat evenly on all sides, about five minutes per side, and transfer the meat to a plate and set aside.  Next, set the heat to medium and add the remaining two tablespoons of olive oil.  Saute the onion, garlic, and chopped herbs, often stirring, until the onions are translucent, for about six minutes.  Now pour in wine and beef stock to deglaze the pot.  Take care to scrape up all the bits from the bottom.  Lastly, add the tomato paste, as well as the browned meat to the pot, then pour in the beef stock so that it reaches halfway up the meat.  Bring to a simmer, then remove from the stove, cover with a sheet of aluminum foil and then with a lid.  Place the pot in the oven and cook for 2 to 2 1/2 hours until the meat is tender.  Take the pot out of the oven and add to it vegetables, bay leaf, and herb springs, taking care they are neatly arranged around the meat, then cover and place back into the oven and cook for 20-30 minutes until the vegetables are done, and the meat is meltingly tender.  Place on a plate and keep covered with aluminum foil for 15 minutes.  Slice the meat against the grain: alternatively you may also use two forks to pull the meat into chunks.  Discard the bay leaf and herb sprigs.  For serving, arrange on a platter with vegetables and spoon over with the sauce.  It is suggested to pair them with a side dish of either mashed potatoes, buttered egg noodles, or rice.

Ingredients: 720g fresh fillets (white fish such as corvina, sea bass, sole, flounder, grouper), 12 Peruvian limes, 2 red aji limo pepper, 2 red onions, 450g cooked sweet potato, 225g cooked corn, salt, fresh cilantro.
Directions: First prepare the ingredients. Deseed and devein the aji limo peppers and slice them into strips.  Cut the onions into thin strips, then place them in ice-cold water. Cut fish filets into 2x2cm cubes.  Squeeze all the limes about halfway and set the juice aside.  Next place fish in a bowl, add salt and aji limo peppers.  Pour in the lime juice, blend well and let it marinate in the regrigerator for 5-30 minutes, depending on taste(the longer the marination time, the more 'cooked' the fish will be).  Drain the onion slices and add them to the bowl with fish and mix.  Serve with sweet potatoes and cooked corn.  Divide between plates, pour over with the marinade juices.  Garnish with cilantro and some more red aji limo peppers.

Ingredients: 2lb beef round thinly sliced, 2 eggs beaten, 2 cups breadcrumbs, 2 garlic cloves chopped, 3 tbsp parsley chopped, salt, black pepper ground, vegetable oil(for frying)
Directions: Slice the beef into a centimeter thick cutlets.  Cut off all the fat and the sinew to get as clean of as cutlets as possible.  Tenderize the cutlets with a mallet until half a centimeter thick.  Whisk the eggs with chopped garlic, chopped parsley, salt, and pepper.  Drench the cutlets in the egg mixture, then let them soak in it in the regrigerator for 45min.  Heat the oil over medium-high heat until it reaches 170C.  Coat the cutlets in breadcrumbs and fry them on both sides for a few minutes, then place them on paper towels to drain.  Serve warm, with some of the following: French Fries, mashed potatoes, green salad, potato salad, or roasted peppers.

Ingredients: 200g dried beef, 200g salted or smoked pork ribs, 200g salted pork feet, 100g salted pork tails, 100g salted pork ears, 150 smoked or salted pork loin, 100g paio sausage, 100g Portuguese sausage, 100g smoked beef tongue, 50g bacon, 900g black beans, 2 cups oil, 200g chopped onion, 100g chopped garlic, 6 bay leaves, 2 oranges, cut in half.
Directions: Clean the salted meat thoroughly by removing the excess fat and hairs.  Soak in water for 24 hours. Change the water 3 to 4 times during this period.  Boil the meat for 20 minutes over high heat.  Throw away the water the meat has been cooked in.  Place the beans, bay leaves, oranges, dried beef, pork feet, and pork ear in a large pot filled with water.  Cook for 30min.  Then add ox tongue, pork tail, and pork ribs and cook for another 30 minutes.  Finally, add the pork loin, paio sausage, Portuguese sausage, and bacon and cook for 30 more minutes.  During cooking, remove and discard any fat that floats on the surface and use a fork to check the degree of softness for each piece of meat.  If you estimate a particular piece is already cooked, take it out of the pot and set aside.  Meanwhile, heat the oil in a frying pan and saute onion and garlic until lightly browned.  Serve with white rice, sauteed cabbage seasoned with olive oil and garlic, and a maioc farofa.  Remove the orange halves from the cooking pot, and stir in sauteed onion and garlic.  Take the meat out of the pot, cut into smaller pieces if necessary, then put back into the pot and simmer for 10-15min over low heat.

Ingredients: 2 1/2 cups lukewarm water, 1 teaspoon salt, 2 cups pre-cooked white corn meal, 1/4 cup vegetable oil
Directions: Stir water and salt together in a bowl.  Gradually stir corn meal into water with your fingers until mixture forms a soft, moist, malleable dough.  Divide dough into 8 golf ball-size balls and pat each one into a patty about 3/8-inch thick.  Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat until shimmering.  Working in batches, cook corn patties in hot oil until golden brown, 4-5 minutes per side.  Transfer cooked arepas to a paper towel-lined plate to drain until cool enough to handle.  Slice halfway through each cake horizontally with a thin serrated knife to form a pita-like pocket.

Ingredients: 1 cup packed fresh parsley washed and dried, 5 medium cloves garlic peeled, 2 tbsp oregano leaves, 1/2 cup oil, 1/4 cup red wine vinegar, 1 tsp kosher salt, 1/4 tsp red pepper flakes
Directions: Finely chop parsley, and mince garlic.  In a medium bowl combine oregano, parsley, and garlic, and pour in oil and vinegar.  Add salt and red pepper flakes.  Mix until well combined.  Serve or refrigerate for up to 2 days.

Ingredients: 2 tbsp vegetable oil, 1lb sirloin steak cut into strips, salt, black pepper, 1/2 red onion sliced, 2 cloves garlic minced, 1 tbsp aji amarillo paste, 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp white vinegar, 1 tbsp fresh cilantro chopped, 1lb french fries cooked hot, white rice cooked.
Directions: Heat 1 tbsp of oil in a large pan over high heat.  Add the steak, season with salt and pepper, and cook until browned, 5-6 minutes.  Remove from the pan.  Heat the remaining tbsp of oil in the same pan, then add the red onion and cook for about 5min until softened and browned.  Add the tomato, garlic, and aji amarillo paste, and cook for another 5-7 min, until the tomatoes have released some of their juices, but are still intact.  Add the soy sauce and vinegar and stir to combine, let cook for 1 minute.  Add the steak, fries, and cilantro.  Toss gently to coat the fries in the sauce.  Serve with rice.

Ingredients: MASHED CASSAVA/YUCA: 2.2lbs cassava/yuca frozen or fresh, 2 tbsp butter softened or melted, 1 to 1-1/4 heavy cream warm, or whole milk or coconut milk, 1 to 2 tbsp Knorr chicken flavored bouillon powder, salt and pepper, 2 cups of any shredded melting cheese of your preference.  CHICKEN: 6 strips thick-cut uncooked smoked bacon medium diced, 1/2 large yellow onion small diced, 2 garlic cloves minced, 1-1/2lbs roasted chicken shredded, 1 cup collard greens cut into thin strips, 1/2 cup dry white wine, 1-1/2 cups tomato sauce, Salt and pepper to taste, 1 cup cooked corn kernels, 1/4 cup chopped parsley or cilantro
Directions: MASHED CASSAVA/YUCA: If using fresh cassava or yuca, peel it first.  Then, place peeled cassava in a pot filled with cold water and let boil over high heat for about 15-20min or until fork-soft.  Remove from the heat, reserve about 1 cup of the water and drain.  Place cooked cassava on a cutting board and while cassava is still warm but can be handled without burning, remove the woody fiber from the center.  Place warm cassava back into the pot, pour the reserved warm water on top, and mash very well using a masher.  Stir in the butter, heavy cream, chicken bouillon, salt and pepper to taste.  Set aside.  Cheese will be used later in the assembling of the dish.  Preheat oven to 350F.  Butter or spray a 13x9 inch baking dish and set aside.  TO PREPARE CHICKEN: In a medium to large non stick dutch oven, cook the diced bacon over medium-high heat for about 5-6min, stirring occasionally with a wooden spoon.  Remove bacon from the pan with a slotted spoon, place into a bowl or plate, and set aside.  In the same pan where bacon has just cooked, sweat the onion in the residual bacon fat over medium heat for about 2-3min, stirring occasionally.  Then add minced garlic and let cook for about 1 minute over medium-high heat for 1-2min, stirring occasionally.  Add the greens and saute for about 1 min.  Add the wine and let almost evaporate.  Stir in the tomato sauce, the reserved cooked bacon, and salt and pepper to taste.  Let cook uncovered over medium heat for 3-4min.  Remove from the heat, stir in the cooked corn kernels, and the chopped parsley or cilantro.  Set aside.  CHICKEN PIE ASSEMBLY: Spoon chicken mixture in one single layer into the greased baking dish.  Layer mashed cassava/yuca on top of the chicken layer.  Finish by sprinkling shredded cheese on top of the chicken layer.  Finish by sprinkling shredded cheese on top of the mashed cassava/yuca, distributing uniformly.  Cover tightly with a sheet of aluminum foil.  Bake for 30-40min.  Serve Esondidinho de frango warm by itself of accompaniied by a fresh salad or steamed vegetables.

Ingredients: 16oz dry black-eyed peas, 2 onions chopped, salt, 1/2lb shrimp, 4 cups coconut milk, 1 1/2oz roasted peanuts, 2 1/2oz cashews, 1 cup manioc flour toasted, Grated ginger, 3 cups dende oil, 1/2 onion with peel, salsa.
Directions: In a food processor add the peas and process until coarse.  Transfer to a bowl and cover with cold water.  The skins will float to the top. Scoop them out and discard.  Allow peas to soak for 8 hours.  Drain water.  In food processor, add the soaked peas and half the chopped onion.  Blend until it turns into a paste.  Transfer to a large mixing bowl; sesaon with salt and mix with a wooden spoon until the volume doubles.  In a blender add the shrimp, coconut milk, peanuts, cashews, remaining chopped onion, manioc flour and ginger.  Blend until well combined, then transfer to a pan.  Season with salt.  Cook mixture over medium heat, stirring so it doesn't thicken.  Add some drops of palm oil, just enough to give it color and flavor.  In a deep-sided pan, add palm oil.  Place half the onion in the pan to gauge cooking temperature.  Place spoonfuls of the shrimp mixture in the oil, and let it fry until it's golden on both sides.  Remove from oil and allow to cool slightly.  Slice in half; stuff with pea mixture, salsa and shrimp.

Ingredients: 1 large Russet potato peeled and cut in sticks, oil for frying, salt, 1 beef sausage, ketchup, mustard, aji amarillo paste, mayonnaise, parsley chopped for garnish.
Directions: Fry the potatoes in batches in hot oil over high heat until golden, then place them on a paper-lined plate and sprinkle with salt.  Slice the sausage into rounds or ovals, then stir-fry in a teaspoon of oil until golden and crispy.  Now add the fries to the pan with sausages.  Serve while still warm, with ketchup, mayonnaise, mustard, and aji amarillo paste.

Ingredients: 1 1/2lbs ground beef, 1 medium yellow onion minced, 4 cloves garlic minced, 3-4tbsp olive oil, 1 14.5oz can diced tomato, 1/2 cup raisins, 1 cup beef broth, 3/4 cup Manzanilla Olives, 1 medium baking potato cubed, 2 medium carrots cubed, 3/4 cup frozen green peas, Salt and pepper to taste.
Directions: Heat oil in cooking pot.  Saute onion and garlic until the onion becomes soft and translucent.  Slowly add the ground beef.  Cook until it turns light brown.  Add diced tomato, beef broth, and raisins.  Stir and let boil. Cover and cook for 15min.  Add olives, carrots, potato, and green peas.  Stir and cover.  Cook for 10-12min.  Season with crushed black pepper and salt.  Cook for 3min more.  Transfer to serving plate.

Ingredients: 3lbs chuck roast, brisket, or flank steak.  2tbsp extra-virgin olive oil.  2 large onions chopped.  2 red bell peppers chopped. 2tbsp Diamond Crystal or 3 1/2 tsp salt.  8 garlic cloves finely grated.  1/2 cup dry white wine.  4tsp sweet paprika.  1tbsp dried Mexican or Italian oregano.  2tsp ground cumin.  1tsp black pepper.  1/2tsp cayenne pepper.  1 28oz can whole peeled tomatoes. 2 bay leaves.  3/4 cup pimiento-stuffed Spanish olives, halved crosswise.  2tsp distilled white vinegar. (for serving: Chopped cilantro, white rice, maduros, and black beans)
Directions: Pat roast dry with paper towels.  Heat oil in large heatproof pot over high.  Cook chuch roast, turning occasionally until browned on both sides, 4-7min per side.  Transfer to plate.  Place rack in lower third of oven; preheat to 250C.  Cook onion, bell peppers, and salt, stirring occasionally until softened and beginning to brown, 12-14min.  Add garlic and cook, stirring frequently and scraping bottom of pan until vegetables are golden brown, 3-5min.  Stir in wine and cook, stirring occasionally, until evaporated.  Stir in paprika, oregano, cumin, black pepper, and cayenne until vegetables are coated; continue to cook, stirring, until spices are fragrant, about 1 minute.  Add tomatoes and coarsely break up with a spoon.  Bring to a boil and cook stirring occasionally, until liquid is reduced by half, about 5min.  Nestle roast into tomato mixture and tuck in bay leaves on either side.  Cover and transfer to oven.  Braise roast and vegetables until meat is very tender and shreds easily, 2 1/2-3 hours.  Let cool 15min.  Skim excess fat from sauce; discard bay leaves.  Using a potato masher or 2 forks, tear and smash beef into sauce until it's shredded and incorporated into sauce.  Stir in olives and vinegar.  Divide ropa vieja among plates.  Top with cilantro.  Serve with rice, maduros, and beans alongside.

Ingredients: 4lbs beef roast top round, 1/2lb chorizo, 8 stuffed olives sliced, 1 orange fresh squeezed juice, 1/2 lemon fresh squeezed juice, 1tsp salt, 1tsp cumin, 1/2 tsp pepper, 1 tsp oregano, 2 tbsp olive oil, 3 Roma tomatoes diced, 1 onion medium diced, 4 garlic cloves minced, 8 sprigs cilantro tied, 2 bay leaves, 3 cups water, 2 tbsp tomato paste.
Directions: Place meat in a resealable bag and add the orange juice, lemon juice and salt. Marinate 8-12 hours.  In a small bowl place salt, pepper, cumin, and oregano.  Insert knife front to back and make an incision across the front.  Stuff with chorizo and olives.  Sprinkle with spice mixture.  Insert skewers (top to bottom) to hold filling in place.  Heat olive oil in a Dutch oven and add the meat.  Brown on all sides.  Turn heat to medium and add the tomatoes, onions, garlic, cilantro, bay leaves, water, and tomato paste.  Cover and cook on low for about 4 hours, turning every 15min or so.  Everytime you turn the meat pour the juice over it to keep the meat hydrated.  Generally served with rice, beans and plantains.

Ingredients: MARINADE: 2-3 cloves garlic sliced, 1 tsp fresh cracked pepper, 1 tsp kosher salt, 1/2 tsp Mexican oregano, Juice of 1 large lime, 1/4 cup olive oil.  AVAOCADO SALSA: 1 small Hass avocado, 1 serrano pepper, roughly chopped, 1 tbsp cilantro, 1 tbsp white onion, Juice of 1/2 lime, 1/3 cup + 2 tsp cold water, salt.  OTHER: 1.1lb skirt steak, 18 small corn tortillas, 1 small white onion finely diced, 1/3 cup cilantro chopped, 1/2 cup radishes sliced, 2 limes sliced into wedges.
Directions: In blender mix all the marinade ingredients until smooth.  Add more salt if necessary.  Pour the marinade into a plastic bag and place the steak inside.  Zip the bad and marinate in the refrigerator for 2 hours.  Clean blender and add ingredients for avaocado salsa.  Blend until creamy, add more salt if required, and pour into serving dish.  Cover with some plastic film and refrigerate until serving time.  Prepare the garnishes - chop the onion and the cilantro, slice the radishes, and cut the limes into wedges.  Cover and chill until ready to serve.  Allow the meat to come to room temperature for at least 40-50min before grilling.  Preheat the outdoor grill for about 8-10min to medium/high heat, with lid closed.  Brush grates with some oil.  Remove any excess marinade from the meat and place it onto the grill.  Grill for approximately 7-10min.  Taking into account the thickness of the steak.  Turn over halfway through the cooking process.  If you wish your steak to be medium/rare, grill until the internal temperature reaches 130-135F.  For a medium cooked steak, let the temperature reach 145F.  Place the steak onto a cutting board and cover it loosely with some foil paper.  Let it rest for 5-7min.  In the meantime, warm the tortillas.  Slice the meat into thin strips, then cut into small, bite-sized chunks.  Assemble tacos with two tortillas stacked.  Top with avocado salsa, onion, cilantro, radishes and lime.

Ingredients: 3 corn tortillas, 1 cup shredded longhorn cheese, 1 tbsp canola oil, 12 pickled jalapeno slices
Directions: Begin by preheating oven to 350F, Apply oil to both sides on each tortilla using a brush.  Cut them into quarters and bake for 7-10 minutes until they become darker brown, but not burnt. Grate the cheese and sprinkle it on top of each tortilla quarter evenly, then top with one slice of pickled jalapeno per triangle.  Place the nachos in a baking dish and bake for 3 more minutes, so the cheese becomes bubbly.  Alternatively you can bake the nachos under a broiler for one minute.  Keep a close watch on the nachos, so they don't burn.

Ingredients: FOR BURRITO: 1/4 cup vegetable oil, 3 large russet potatoes shredded, 1/2 tsp salt, freshly ground black pepper, 1 medium onion chopped, 1 garlic clove minced, 2-3 large eggs lightly beaten, 4 flour tortillas warmed, 8 slices bacon cooked until crisp, 6-8oz mild cheddar cheese grated.  FOR GREEN CHILE SAUCE: 2tbsp vegetable oil, 1/2-1 medium onion finely chopped, 2-3 garlic cloves minced, 1 tbsp all-purpose flour, 2 cups chopped roasted mild to medium-hot New Mexican green chile fresh or thawed frozen, 2 cups chicken or beef stock. FOR RED CHILE SAUCE: 8oz dried whole red New Mexican chile pods, 4 cups water or chicken stock, 2 tbsp vegetable oil, 1 medium onion minced, 3 garlic cloves minced, 1-2 tsp crumbled dried Mexican oregano or marjoram, 1 tsp salt.
Directions: Start with preparing the green and red chile sauce.  For the green chile sauce, saute onion and garlic in a saucepan over medium heat for about 5min, until the onion becomes soft.  Add flour, stir, and cook for another 1-2min.  Now, add the chile and chicken or beef broth, and season with salt.  After mixture boils, turn down the heat and simmer for 15min.  The sauce should be thickened but still liquid.  For the red chile sauce, warm up a heavy skillet and toast the dried whole chile pods for 1-2min on each side.  Let them cool, put on some rubber gloves, and then break them up, removing stems and seeds.  Process them in a blender with 2 cups of water or chicken stock.  Heat the oil, and saute onion and garlic in a saucepan until the onion withers.  Stir in the blended chile, oregano, marjoram, and salt.  Pour in the remaining water or chicken stock, puree, reduce the heat and continue simmering for 20-25min.  Now prepare the burritos.  Preheat oven to 400F.  Slice the onions and grate the potatoes.  Heat the oil in a large skillet and add the potatotes.  Season with salt and pepper, even out, and cook for several minutes.  Then turn the potatoes over using a spatula, add onion and garlic, pat down and continue cooking for 12-15min, turning over occasionally, until the potatoes are golden brown and crispy.  Whisk the eggs and pour them over the potatoes.  Stir until the eggs are cooked, but still soft.  Fill each of the 4 tortillas with 1/4 of the potato-egg mixture and 2 slices of bacon.  Roll gently, so the seam side is on the bottom, and transfer to a baking tray.  Drizzle with red and green chile sauce and sprinkle with grated cheese.  Bake for 5 min, until the cheese has melted, and serve immediately.

Ingredients: 3L water, 1/2kg pozolero corn, 1/2 tbsp lime, 30g garlic, 1 tbsp mixed herbs, 1 1/2kg mixed pork, 1 tbsp salt, 50g onion.  CHILI DE ARBOL SAUCE: 100g dried chili de arbol without stems, 1 clove garlic, 1 cup pineapple vinegar, salt.  GARNISH: 1 onion finely chopped, 3 radishes sliced, 1/2 head romaine lettuce shredded, 6 lemons, 30g dry oregano.
Directions: Place water, pozolero corn, and lime into a large pot and bring them to a boil.  Leave overnight, and on the next day drain the water and hull the corn kernels.  Put the cleaned corn kernels into a pot of clean water.  Cook until the corn bursts.  In a separate pot, cook the pork meat in water with salt, garlic, onion, and herbs until it softens.  Strain the broth and cut the meat into small pieces.  Return the meat and the broth to the pot of pozole.  Adjust the seasoning and bring to a boil.  To make the chili de arbol sauce, lightly toast dried chilis in a frying pan with a clove of garlic.  Process the chilis in a blender, add roasted garlic, vinegar, and salt.  Pulse again until a thick sauce is formed.  To serve, pour the pozole into separate serving bowls and serve with chili de arbol sauce, onion, radishes, lettuce, lemon, and oregano and on the side.

Ingredients: 4 green plantains, 1lb of chicharron, 3 garlic cloves mashed, 4tsp of olive oil, 2 cups frying oil.
Directions: Peel the plantains and cut them into 1 1/2 inch slices.  Place them in salted water for 15min to soak.  Drain on a cloth.  Fry the plantains in a 350F oil for about 12min until just golden.  Do not let them get very brown othewise they won't mash well.  Drain on paper towels.  Mash in mortar and pestle in batches, with some of the mashed garlic, olive oil and some chicharron.  Shape into four domes, one per each serving.  Serve as is, or with broth or meat.

Ingredients: MAKING THE DOUGH: 1L water, 40-60g salt, 3g fresh yeast, 1.6-1.8kg flour.  THE TOPPING: 60-80g canned peeled tomatoes, 6-7g virgin or extra virgin olive oil, 80-100g mozzarella/fior di latte, a few fresh basil leaves leaves, 5-7g hard cheese grated
Directions: MAKING THE DOUGH: Dissolve salt in water, then add the yeast to the water and dissolve.  Immediately add a portion of the flour to the water and mix.  Add the remaining flour in batches, gauging how much flour is enough.  Knead for a minimum of 15-20min, but ideally 30min.  The dough is of ideal consistency when it's a bit sticky on the hands, and on the sides of a bowl, you're mixing it in.  Shape it into a ball, then lightly coat with flour, to prevent losing moisture as it rises.  FERMENTING THE DOUGH: Place the dough in a large bowl, then cover it with a cloth and store it in a warm place for two hours.  After two hours have passed, shape the dough into balls weighing either 200 or 280grams, depending on the size of the pizza you're making, 22-24cm or a 28-35cm one.

Ingredients: 311g of dark chocolate, 6 large eggs, 36g butter(half salted, half unsalted), 48g sugar, Pinch of salt
Directions: Use a bain-marie(double boiler) to melt the chocolate and the butter until creamy and completely melted.  Cool slightly.  After separating the egg yolks and whites, place the egg whites in an immaculately clean big bowl.  Make sure ther are no traces of fat left in the bowl since that can stop the egg whites from fluffing.  Add a pinch of salt and beat the egg whites until stiff peaks.  Be mindful not to overbeat the whites.  Whipping gently, add the egg yolks and the sugar to the melted chocolate, one at a time.  When the mixture combines fully, lightly fold in a third of the egg whites.  Now, add the remaining egg whites, blending carefully.  Transfer the mousse into ramekins or bowls and put in the refrigerator to harden for at least 4-6 hours.

Ingredients: 360g paella rice, arroz bomba or arroz redondo.  400g chicken meat with bone in, pieces of approx 4x4cm.  400g rabit meat with bone in, pieces of approx 4x4cm.  200g fresh Spanish garrofon beans or butter beans.  300g of green beans, in pieces of approx 4cm.  1 large tomato grated.  Approx 20 saffron strings soaked in a bit hot water.  1 sprig of rosemary.  1800ml of water.  100ml of extra virgin olive oil.  Salt.
Directions: Place the paellera over a medium flame and fry the meats in olive oil for approximately 20 min, until golden brown.  Season with some salt during the frying process.  Next, add the fresh beans and lightly brown them.  Push the sauteed ingredient to the sides of the paellera and add the grated tomato in the center of the skillet.  Sautee the tomato until it becomes dark red, then combine it with the rest of the ingredients already in the pan.  Stir in the saffron and the liquid it was soaking in.  Pour the water in, throw in a rosemary sprig, and bring to a boil.  Measure the amount of liquid in the paellera using a spoon or a ruler, season with some salt.  When a bit less than half of the liquid has evaporated, add the rice.  Distribute the rice and the other ingredients evenly across the pan.  Take out the rosemary sprig.  Cook the paella over a high flame for approximately 8min, then lower heat, and cook for another 8 min, or until the liquid evaporates.  Now, turn on the heat again to make the soccarat.  When you hear and smell the toasting of the rice, remove the skillet from the heat.  Let it settle for about 5min before serving.

Ingredients: 2 lbs bintje potatoes, vegetable oil, salt
Directions: Peel the potatoes cut them first into 1cm thick slices and then into strips that are 1cm wide.  Place them in water for a few minutes, so that as much starch as possible gets washed out.  Take them out of the water and pat them dry thoroughly.  Fill a deep fryer or a frying pan with oil then heat it to a 160C.  Fry the potatoes in batches, adding only a handful at a time, for four to eight minutes, depending on the thickness.  Make sure to flip them often, so they do not stick.  Place them on a large plate lined with a paper towel and leave them to cool for at least half an hour.  Next, up the heat to 190C, then fry the potatoes a second time, but this time for two minutes only until they are golden and crisp.  Sprinle with salt, and serve with mayonnaise.

Ingredients: 500g risott rice, 60g butter, 30g beef marrow, 2L beef broth, 1 onion finely diced, 1 pinch of saffron dissolved in a cup of broth, grated Parmesan, Salt.
Directions: In a large heated saucepan add butter, diced onion, and marrow, the saute over a low flame until the onion becomes see-through.  Add the rice and mix thoroughly so that the rice absorbs the flavors.  Increase the heat and gradually start to add the hot beef broth to the rice, a ladle at a time, all the while mixing in regular, circular motions.  Each time the rice soaks up the broth, add some more.  Cook for approximately 15min, making sure the rice remains al dente.  Add the remaining broth with the saffron dissolved in it and turn off the heat.  Add grated parmesan and season with some salt.

Ingredients: FOR THE DOUGH: 500g flour all purpose, 1 package yeast rapid rise, 1 1/2 tbsp sugar, 4 tbsp butter melted, 300ml water lukewarm.  FOR THE LYE: 1 1/2L water, 1 1/2 tsp salt, 2 tbsp baking soda. OTHER: 1-2tbsp coarse salt
Directions: Attach a kneeding hook onto the stand mixer.  Add the flour, sugar, and yeast into the mixing bowl and combine with a spoon. Melt the butter and mix in with lukewarm water.  Kneed the dough at low speed for approximately 6min, gradually adding the butter and water mixture into the dry ingredients.  If you decide to use a handheld mixer instead, knead with hooks for approximately 10min.  Coat a bowl with some flour, then place the dough in.  Cover with a kitchen towel and leave to rise for about an hour or until the dough doubles in size.  Knead the rested dough with your hands, shape it into a long roll, and cut into 12 equal chunks(approx 70g each)  Next, roll the chunks into 20-inch strips, making sure that the middle part remains thicker than the ends.  The ends of the strips should be thick as a pencil.  Shape the strips into pretzels.  To make the lye, pour water into a high-sided saucepan, season with salt, and bring to a boil.  Remove the saucepan from the heat, then gradually and carefully add the baking soda, all the while stirring.  The soda will produce bubbles.  Bring the mixture back to a boil, then dunk the pretzels into the lye for 30 seconds (ensure they are completely covered in liquid)  Cover a cooling rack with some baking paper.  Use a skimming ladle to transfer the pretzels onto the rack.  Dry them with some paper towel, if necessary.  Make a horizontal cut in the thick part of the pretzel and sprinkle with some coarse salt.  Arrange the pretzels onto a baking tray covered with parchment paper and leave to rise for 15-20min.  Bake the pretzels on the middle rack in an oven preheated to 180-190C for 15-20min.  Remove the pretzels from the oven and allow them to cool on the cooling rack.

Ingredients: 3 tbxp olive oil or 50g butter, 300g coarse minced beef, 150g pancetta(unsmoked) finely diced, 50g carrots finely diced, 50g celery finely diced, 50g onion finely diced, 300g tomato passata or peeled tomatoes, Beef or poultry stock as needed, 1 cup whole milk, 1/2 cup red wine, salt and pepper, 1/2 cup whipping cream
Directions: Start by melting and browning pancetta in a heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium-low heat until the fat melts away.  Add olive oil or butter, carrots, celery, and onion.  Saute the vegetables for about 10-15min or until soft.  Add minced beef, turning the heat up to high, and constantly stirring.  When the meat is well browned, pour in the wine and stir until it completely evaporates.  Stir in tomato passata or peeled tomatoes, partially cover and let it simmer slowly for about 2 hours, adding some stock as necessary and occasionally stirring.  Towards the end of cooking, once the beef is tender, add a cup of milk to soften the acidity of tomatoes.  Season to taste with salt and pepper.  Lastly if ragu is to be served with dry pasta instead of fresh taglatelle add 1/2 cup liquid whipping cream to the sauce.

Ingredients: SHORTCRUST PASTRY: 200g flour, 100g butter, 1 pinch of salt, cold water as needed.  FILLING: 4 eggs, 200 ml creme fraiche, 200g smoked bacon, Pepper & nutmeg as desired, butter for frying.
Directions: Preheat oven to 180C.  Place flour and salt into a large bowl, add the cubes of butter and work the butter into the flour with your fingers until the mixture becomes breadcrumb like.  Knead, adding cold water tablespoon by tablspoon to the flour and butter mixture just until it comes together into a smooth dough.  Wrap the ball of dough in cling film and refrigerate for 30min.  Lightly flour your working surface, then place the ball of dough on the flour and roll it out to fit a 23cm quiche pan, making sure you roll it out enough to cover the bottom and the sides of the pan.  Place the dough into a quiche pan that you've lined with baking paper, taking care it covers the bottom and the sides.  Cut off any excess dough.  Prick the dough with a fork.  Place baking paper over the dough, fill the pastry shell with beans or rice, then bake the crust for 10min.  Remove the rice or beans, along with the baking paper, and bake for another 10min.  Let the dough cool a bit.  Meanwhile, cut the bacon into strips, then fry it in a small amount of butter, just until it's cooked through and rendered but not crisp.  Drain the bacon paper towels, and throw away the rendered fat.  Arrange the strips of bacon on the bottom of the quiche shell.  Next, whisk the creme fraiche and the eggs in a separate bowl.  Add pepper and nutmeg, if desired.  Also, if needed, strain the custard to remove any leftover egg chunks.  Then pour the custard over the bacon into the quiche shell.  Bake for 15min.

Ingredients: 12oz spaghetti, rigatoni, tonnarelli, or mezze maniche.  4oz guanciale(or rindless bacon, if guanciale is not available).  1/4 cup pecorino Romano, finely grated(or Parmigiano-Reggiano).  4 fresh large egg yolks, salt, black pepper freshly ground.
Directions: If you'd like the end up with a crispier guanciale, first cut the guanciale into 1/2cm slices, then stack them, and cut into 5cm long strips.  If you'd like the guanciale to have more of a chew to it, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, cut it into dices that are 1/2x1/2cm.  Add the yolks, the pecorino Romano, and a pinch of freshly ground black pepper to a bowl, then mix with a whisk.  Saute the guanciale(do not add any oil) over medium heat for 2 min, until crisp and rendered.  Take off heat and let it cool.  Cook the pasta according to package directions.  However drain it (preserve some of the pasta cooking water for later) a bit sooner than it states on the packaging, as it needs to be just shy of al dente.  It will continue to cook when mixed with the sauce.  Add the reserved pasta cooking water to the pan with guanciale, then add the pasta and stir thoroughly.  Next, take the pan with the guanciale and pasta of heat, then add the yolk and cheese mixture and stir quickly; otherwise, the eggs might get scrambled.  Season with more freshly ground pepper.  Serve lukewarm on warmed plates.

Ingredients: FOR THE CHIPS: 800g unpeeled even size potato.  2 tbsp olive oil.  FOR THE PEAS: 300g frozen garden pea, 1 tbsp olive oil, 2 tsp lemon juice.  FOR THE FISH: 650g skinless haddock, hake or cod fillet, cut into 4 equal-size pieces.  50g self-raising flour, plus 1 tbsp, 50g cornflour, 1 egg white, 125ml ice-cold sparkling water, 1 lemon cut into wedges, 600ml sunflower oil for frying.
Directions: To prep the potatoes, scrub them and cut them first into 1.5cm slices, and then cut each slice into 1.5cm thick chips.  Transfer the chips to a large saucepan and cover them with water.  Once the water is boiling, lower the heat and leave to simmer for only four minutes, then drain, and transfer onto clean cloth.  Pat dry the chips and leave them to cool.  While the chips are cooling, set the oven to preheat to 220C.  Once heated, place a large, shallow non-stick tray with one tbsp of olive oil onto the oven and leave it to warm for 10min.  Place the now cooled chips in a bowl and toss them with the remaining oil.  Arrange them in a single layer on a hot tray and bake them first for 10min, then turn them over and bake for another 5min.  Now, turn the chips a second time and bake them for 5-8min until they crisp up then place them on a paper towel to drain.  While the chips are still baking, you can prepare the peas.  Cook them in boiling water for four minutes.  Drain them and transfer them to a bowl, then using the back of a fork, lightly crush them.  Mix in the oil, lemon juice, and freshly grated pepper, then cover and set aside.  Put 1 tbsp of flour on a plate and pat dry the fish fillets with paper towels.  Coat each fillet in flour and pat off the excess.  Separately combine 50g flour, cornflour, a pinch of salt, and some ground pepper, then in another bowl whisk an egg white until it bubbles up.  Pour the water into the flour mix, carefully whisking as you pour, then add the egg white and whisk just until it mixes into the batter, which should not be entirely smooth, and you want to make sure you keep as many bubbles as possible.  Half-fill an heavy non-stick wok or a pan with oil and heat it to 200C.  Dip the fish fillets into the batter, making sure they are evenly coated and then immediately place them in hot oil.  Fry two fish fillets at a time for 5-6 minutes, turning them halfway through, all the time making sure the oil doesn't fall or go above 200C.  Use a slotted spoon to take the fillets out of the oil and place on a paper towel to drain.  Repeat the process with the remaining fillets.  Reheat the peas and divide them between plates, then add to each a portion of fish, chips and lemon wedges.

Ingredients: 1 garlic clove halve, 1lb Gruyere cheese grated, 1/2lb Emmentaler cheese or other Swiss cheese grated, 1 cup dry white wine, 1 tbsp plu 1 tsp cornstarch, 1 tsp fresh lemon juice, 1 1/2 tbsp kirsch, Freshly ground pepper, Freshly grated nutmeg
Directions: Rub the inside of a cheese fondue pot or medium enameled cast-iron casserole with the garlic clove; discard the garlic.  Combine the grated Gruyere and Emmentaler with the wine, cornstarch and lemon juice in the fondue pot and cook over moderate heat, stirring, occasionally, until the cheeses begin to melt, about 5 minutes.  Add the kirsch and a generous pinch each of pepper and nutmeg and cook, stirring gently, until creamy and smooth, about 10min; don't overcook the fondue or it will get stringy.  Serve at once.

Ingredients: THE DOUGH: 1L water, 40-60g salt, 3g fresh yeast, 1.6-1.8kg flour, THE TOPPING: 60-80g canned peeled tomatoes, 6-7g virgin or extra virgin olive oil, 80-100g mozzarella/fior di latte, a few fresh basil leaves, 5-7g hard cheese grated
Directions: MAKING THE DOUGH: Dissolve salt in water, then add yeast to the water and dissolve.  Immediately add a portion of the flour to the water and mix.  Add the remaining flour in batches, gauging how much flour is enough.  Knead for a minimum of 15-20min, but ideally 30min.  The dough is of ideal consistency when it's a bit sticky on the hands, and on the sides of a bowl you're mixing it in.  Shape it into a ball then lightly coat with flour to prevent losing moisture as it rises.  FERMENTING THE DOUGH: Place the dough in a large bowl then cover it with a cloth and store it in a warm place for two hours.  After two hours have passed, shape the dough into balls weighing either 200 or 280g, depending on the size of the pizza you're making.  A 22-24cm or a 28-35cm one.  Once you've shaped the balls place them all on a plate and cover them with a damp cloth and let them prove for a minimum of six hours.  SHAPING THE DOUGH: Once at least six hours have passed, take a ball of dough, place it on a lightly floured surface.  Pressing on the ball of dough with the thumbs of your fingers, starting from the center and going towards the edges, shape into a disc, turning the dough several times in the process.  As a result of this action, you should end up with a disc that has about a 1-2cm raised rim with a center that should be approximately 0.3cm thick.  THE TOPPING: Arrange the topping(listed amounts are for a single pizza) as follows; First, place the crushed, peeled tomatoes in the center of the pizza, then spread them with a spoon all over, except the rim, in a spiraling fashion.  Next, scatter the mozzarella or fior di latte evenly over the surface.  Followed by a sprinkling of hard grated cheese, if you're using it.  Place a few basil leaves on top, and to finish, drizzle with extra virgin olive oil, which should be applied in a circular motion, starting from the center outwards.  BAKING: Place the pizza on a pizza peel and then slide it into a wood-fired oven with a quick wrist motion, so the topping stays in place.  Bake for 60-90 seconds in a wood-fired oven at a temperature of about 485C, checking the doneness by carefully lifting the edges of the pizza.  Also, the pizza should be rotated as it bakes but kept in the same cooking area, so every part gets baked evenly.  WHEN DONE:  The finished pizza should have a thick tomato sauce with melted mozzarella and basil leaves that have browned but are not burnt.

Ingredients: 5-6 tbsp of mirepoix, 105g butter, 1.25L of consomme or fish stock, 75g short-grain rice, 2 small lobsters, 7 tbs of dry white wine, 3 tbs of cognac, salt, pepper, cayenne pepper, bouquet garni, 150ml creme fraiche
Directions: Start by sauteing mirepoix in 40g butter and add to it two small lobsters that you've cut into pieces together with salt, pepper, and a bouquet garni.  Saute everything until the lobster shells turn red.  In a small ladle heat up 3 tbsp of cognac, pour that over the lobster, set alight and stir well.  Next, add 7 tbps of dry white wine and cook until it's reduced by two-thirds, then follow by adding 150ml of consomme and cook carefully for the next ten min.  When cold, shell the lobsters, finely dice the tail meat and save for garnishing later.  Pound the shells and process them with the rice cooked in 500ml of consomme, together with the cooking liquid.  Press that through a fine sieve and combine the shell puree together with the remaining consomme and boil for 5-6 minutes.  Make sure the bisque has cooled slightly before serving, add a dash of pepper, creme fraiche, and the remaining butter cut up into small pieces.  To finish, add the diced tail meat and serve piping hot.

Ingredients: blank
Directions: blank

Ingredients: FOR PORK GYROS: 1 pork tenderloin cut into strips, 1 clove garlic chopped, 1/2 red onion sliced, 3-4 tbsp of olive oil, 1-2 tbsp red wine vinegar, 1 tbsp oregano, thyme, rosemary, 1/2 tbsp honey.  FOR TZATZIKI SAUCE: 1 cucumber, 2 cloves garlic, 1/4 cut extra virgin olive oil, 500g yogurt, 1-2 tbsp red wine vinegar, salt and freshly ground pepper.  TO SERVE: 4 pita breads, 1 red onion sliced, 1 tomato sliced, fried potatoes, lettuce.
Directions: Begin with preparing the pork gyros: cut the tenderloin into thin strips and place them in a large bowl.  Add garlic, onion, olive oil, vinegar and herbs and combine squeezing with your hands.  To finish, add honey, cover the bowl, and place it into the fridge for at least 2 hours and preferably overnight.  Heat a large non-sticking pan.  Toss in the pork with the entire marinade and saute for 1 minute without stirring.  Then, turn the ingredients on the other side and saute for another minute, until the meat is browned and crispy on the outside, but still soft and juicy on the inside.  Now, prepare the tzatziki sauce.  Pulse olive oil and garlic in a food processor until garlic is completely smooth and no chunks are left behind.  Grate the cucumber, season with salt and leave for 10min.  Now, drain the water out of the cucumber by wrapping it in a towel or a firm kitchen cloth and squeezing it with your hands.  Mix cucumber, blended garlic and olive oil, yogurt, vinegar, salt and pepper and put in a refrigerator to cool completely.  Preheat the oven to 250C.  Brush both sides of pita breads with some oil and season them with salt, pepper, and oregano.  Bake for 1 minute.  To finish, spread some tzatziki on the pita bread, arrange the gyros on top, and add sliced tomato and onion.  If you want to, you can also stuff some fried potatoes and lettuce in the pita bread.  Wrap the pita bread like a sandwich and serve.

Ingredients: 1 whole raw Grade A duck or goose foie gras at room temperature cleaned and deveined.  4 tsp kosher salt, 1/2 tsp freshly ground white pepper, 1/4 cup Sauternes or 3 tbsp Armagnac.
Directions: Line a small roasting pan with either a folded kitchen towel or 6 layers of paper towels, and set the oven to preheat to 200F.  Sprinkle both sides of the liver lobes, as well as any loose pieces of liver, with salt and white pepper.  Sprinkle a third of the Sauternes in a terrine, then firmly press the larger lobe of foie gras smooth side down into the bottom of a terrine and pack any loose foie gras pieces into the bottom as well so that foie gras liver fits tightly.  Sprinkle with a third of Sauternes and place a smaller liver lobe into the terrine, smooth side up.  Press firmly, so it fits tightly, and the surface gets flat.  Tightly press the cling film onto the surface of the terrine to seal, then put a lid or foil on top of the terrine to cover it.  Place a terrine inside a roasting pan and fill it halfway up the terrine with hot water.  Put the roasting pan with the terrine inside into the preheated oven on a rack adjusted to the middle position.  Bake for 1 1/2 hours or until an instant-read thermometer reads 120F when inserted diagonally into the center of foie gras.  Take the terrine out of the pan, pour the water out and dispose of the towels.  Place the terrine back into the roasting pan and remove the lid.  Place a wrapped cardboard onto the surface of the foie gras, then put weights on top of the cardboard.  Leave the foie gras this way for 20 minutes at room temperature.  Take the weights and cardboard off the terrine and spoon back any fat that might have dripped over the side of the terrine onto the top to seal.  Cover the terrine and chill in the refrigerator for at least a day.  To unmold, run a hot knife around the edge of the foie gras and invert it on a plate.  Now, reinvert so that the side with the layer of fat is up.  For serving cut into slices with a heated sharp knife.

Ingredients: Warm water, Sugar or Honey, Active dry yeast, Flour, Olive oil, Fresh rosemary
Directions: Proof the yeast in the warm water and sugar.  Knead the dough, gradually add in flour, olive oil and salt.  Then knead for 5 minutes using the dough attachment or a stand mixer, or knead the dough by hand.  First dough rise.  Shape the dought into a ball and place it in a greased mixing bowl, and cover with a damp towel.  Let the dough rest in a warm location for 45-60min, or until it has doubled in size.  Second dough rise.  Shape the dough into a large circle or rectangle until that the dough is about 1/2 inch thick.  Cover and let the dough continue to rise for another 20 minutes.  Prepare the dough.  Heat oven to 400F.  Transfer the dough to a large parchment-covered baking sheet.  Use your fingers to poke deep dents.  Seriously, poke all the way down until you touch the baking sheet, all over the surface of the dough.  Then drizzle a tablespoon of two of olive oil evenly all over the top of the dough, and sprinkle evenly with the fresh rosemary needles and sea salt.  Bake for 20 minutes, or until the dough is slightly golden and cooked through.  Serve.  Remove from oven and drizzle with a little more olive oil if desired.  Slice, and serve warm.

Ingredients: FOR FILLING: 2lbs ground beef, 4 medium potatoes, 1 red pepper thinly sliced, 1 carrot quartered and thinly sliced, 1 onion diced, 1 bunch green onions thinly sliced, 1tsp black pepper, 1tbsp salt, 1/4 cup water or broth, 2tbsp oil.  FOR DOUGH: 4 cups flour 500g, 1 cup melted butter(about 200g), 4 teaspoons baking powder, 1/2 cup hot water, 1tsp salt, 1 egg, 1 egg yolk for egg wash.
Directions: To prepare dough, place the flour, salt and baking powder into a large bowl.  Add the melted butter and hot water, and mix using a spoon.  When mixed, it will still feel a bit dry, add the egg and mix.  If you add the egg with the hot butter, it can cook the egg, which ruins the dough.  Place the dough on a lightly floured surface.  The dough will be soft, so gently knead to keep the dough soft.  Prepare the vegetables.  Mix together the ground beef, thinly sliced vegetables, black pepper, salt, water and oil.  Cut the dough in 2/3 and 1/3 pieces.  The 2/3 will be used as the base of the Pirog pie, and the 1/3 piece will be the cover.  Roll the dough into about 1/2cm or 1/4 thick.  Put the larger dough inside a 8.5 x 11.5 baking pan, including up the sides. You can lightly grease the pan if you like, however the dough has enough butter so I find it doesn't stick.  Place the meat mixture inside and cover with the small piece of dough.  Pinch the dough edges together to seal.  Cut off any excess dough and set aside to make a dough pattern on top.  Using a fork, pierce the dough randomly across the top, to allow steam to escape when cooking.  Ensure the holes seal up, you can also cut a round circle in the middle.  Roll out the excess dough, and cut some leaf patterns.  Place on top of the pie.  Beat the egg yolk and brush the dough for a golden finish.  Preheat the oven to 350F/180C.  Place into the oven and cook for about 50-60min until golden brown, the potatoes are soft and the meat runs clear.

Ingredients: 1lb chopped meat(traditionally minced or ground lamb), 3tbsp butter or lard, 3tbsp chopped onions, 1 cup tomato sauce, 1/2 cup dry breadcrumbs, 1 cup grated cheese, 2tbsp chopped parsley, 1 cup water, 3 or 4 round eggplants, salt, ground pepper, ground nutmeg.  BECHAMEL SAUCE: 1 quart milk, 1 cup flour, 3-4 tbsp butter, 2 eggs, salt, white pepper, grated nutmeg.
Directions: Heat the butter or lard and saute chopped onions until browned.  Next, add the meat and stir until mixture reaches crumbly texture.  Stir in tomato sauce, wine, water, salt, pepper, parsley and nutmeg.  Use a lid to cover the pan and cook over low heat for one hour.  Cut the eggplants in thick slices.  Sprinkle with salt and let strain in a colander.  Fry the eggplant slices in deep fat, and strain again.  Moussaka can be made using other vegetables, such as potatoes, the combination of potatoes and eggplants, or eggplants, potatoes and pumpkins.  Prepare the bechamel by slowly heating milk, flour, butter and salt, white pepper and grated nutmeg.  And the eggs, and whisk until thick and completely smooth.  Place the eggplants in shallow pan and sprinkle with breadcrumbs.  Remove the meat from stove and stir in half the amount of grated cheese and half the breadcrumbs.  Using a spoon, spread an even layer of cooked meat over the fried eggplants.  Pour the bechamel sauce over the meat and eggplants.  Place the remaining cheese and breadcrumbs on top.  Finish with melted butter and bake for 15 minutes.  The moussaka is done when the top has turned golden brown.  Allow to cool and serve cut in squares.

Ingredients: 500g herring, 2-4 beets, 4-5 potatoes, 2-3 carrots, 1 onion, 4-5 eggs, 250g mayonnaise.  FOR DECORATION: Parsley, canned green peas
Directions: Prepare three cooking pots.  In the first one, boil unpeeled potatoes and carrots for 20-30min, until they are soft.  In the second one, boil beets for 40-45min, depending on their size.  Finally, hard boil the eggs in the third one, about 10 minutes.  Set aside and cool.  Cut the herring into fillets and then into smaller pieces.  Peel and finely chop the onions.  If they taste bitter, soak them in shortly in boiling water.  Peel the vegetables and the eggs and prepare one or two flat-bottomed salad bowls.  Now start making layers.  Cover the bottom with a layer of herring.  Top evenly with chopped onions.  Take a coarse grater and grate a layer of potatoes, so they fully cover the onions.  Then spread mayonnaise on top.  Grate the eggs and spread them evenly on the surface, so they form the fourth layer.  Again, cover the mayonnaise.  Grate the carrots, create the fifth layer, and cover with mayonnaise.  Finish with a layer of grated beets on top and gently pat with your hands.  Decorate with fresh parsley and canned green peas.  Cool in the refrigerator for at least two hours and serve.

Ingredients: 1kg of young beef sirloin, salt.  CARPACCIO SAUCE: 250g homemade mayonnaise, 1tsp freshly squeezed lemon juice, 1-2tsp Worcestershire sauce, 30-45ml milk, freshly ground pepper, salt.
Directions: First, take a piece of young beef sirloin and remove every trace of fat, gristle, and silver.  Place the meat in the refrigerator and leave to cool.  When the sirloin has cooled down completely, cut it into thin slices using a sharp knife or a slicing machine.  Place slices of meat on 6 shallow plates so each plate is fully covered.  Salt lightly and return to fridge for at least 5 minutes.  To make the carpaccio sauce, mix mayonnaise, Worcestershire sauce and lemon juice in a bowl.  Add milk to dilute slightly, and to taste with salt and pepper.  Drizzle the carpaccio sauce over the meat, and serve immediately.

Ingredients: 1 cup buckwheat groats, 2 cups water, salt, 30g vegetable oil, butter to taste.
Directions: Wash buckwheat groats several times or under running water.  Transfer them to an adequate-sized pot, and cover with water.  Add salt and vegetable oil.  Cover and cook over medium heat until the water evaporates.  If you wish, add butter into the cooked kasha and let it melt.  Serve hot.

Ingredients: 800ml milk, 1 vanilla bean, 8 egg yolks, 8 egg whites, 1 pinch of salt, 290g caster sugar.  FOR CARAMEL: 100g caster sugar, 2 tbsp water.
Directions: Split the vanilla bean and scrape it into the milk.  Bring the milk to a boil, and in the meantime break the eggs, separating the egg whites from the egg yolks.  Now prepare the meringue.  Preheat the oven to 180C.  Whisk the egg whites into a firm snow with a pinch of salt and 40g sugar, added gradually.  Transfer the whisked egg whites into a savarin mold 22cm in diameter.  Place the mold into a bain-marie and bake for 30 minutes, until the top begins to brown slightly.  Let it cool completely.  Meanwhile, whip 8 egg yolks and 250g of sugar in a large bowl until they become light and fluffy.  Heat the vanilla-flavored milk and pour it slowly over this mixture, stirring constantly.  Transfer the custard into a cooking pot and cook over low heat, until it thickens.  Now, pour the custard into a large bowl whose diameter is larger than the one of the savarin mold, and place in a refrigerator to cool completely.  Remove the meringue from the mold and put it on top of the custard.  Now prepare the caramel.  In a heavy bottomed saucepan, melt sugar in water over very low heat.  After it has melted, increase the heat slightly and bring to a boil.  Do not stir, but rather tip the saucepan to distribute the heat.  Drizzle the caramel over the meringue.  Refrigerate until ile flottante is ready to be served.

Ingredients: FOR THE SHELLS: 150g plain flour, 50g caster sugar, 25g lard, 10g cocoa powder, 1 egg, 1tbsp Marsala or white wine, extra virgin olive oil.  FOR FILLING: 500g sheep's milk ricotta, 150g sugar, vanilla extract, dark chocolate, candied orange peel, chopped pistachios.
Directions: Add all the ingredients for the pastry shells to a large bowl.  While mixing continuously, add wine or vinegar, then knead until you have a firm ball of dough with a texture similar to Play-Doh.  Cover the bowl with a kitchen towel, and set aside for 30 minutes so that the dough can rest.  Using a rolling pin, roll the dough out to thin sheets.  Alternatively, you can use a pasta machine for that.  Draw out an oval template on a piece of parchment paper, and use it to cut out oval shapes from the sheets of dough.  Wrap each cut-out piece of dough around a cannoli tin tube, making sure the two edges of the dough overlap.  Brush with a beaten egg white in between the edges of the dough, then overlap, and press lightly so the dough sticks together.  Once all cannoli shells are assembled, fry in hot lard or olive oil.  Transfer each finished cannoli onto a baking tray lined with paper towels to drain.  Wait for them to dry and cool completely, then remove the tubes.  Strain the ricotta through a fine mesh sieve, then combine the ricotta with sugar, vanilla extract, and chocolate flakes. Fill the piping bad with ricotta cream, then pipe the filling on each side of each cannoli shell.  Once all the cannoli shells are filled with ricotta cream, decorate them with candied orange peel and ground pistachios.  Dust with powdered sugar and serve immediately.

Ingredients: 1 kg pork shoulder boneless, 1 medium onion grated, 3 cloves of garlic minced, 1 tsp salt heaping, 1 tsp black pepper heaping, 1/4 cup olive (or canola) oil, 1 tsp dried Greek oregano heaping.
Directions: Cut off any excess fat or membranes from the meat, then cut it into equal sized cubes.  Toss the meat in a large bowl together with all the marinade ingredients, then refrigerate for a minimum of five hours (best overnight).  Also place the wooden skewers in a shallow container filled with water overnight.  The next day take the meat out of the refrigerator and first wait until it comes to room temperatur and skewer it.  Grill the souvlaki over medium-high heat, about 3-4 minutes per side.  Keep warm until ready to serve.  Sprinkle the grilled souvlaki with lemon juice, salt, and Greek oregano.  Serve just with bread, or inside a pita with tzatziki sauce and toppings of your choice.

Ingredients: 3 large tomatoes, 1 cucumber, 1 onion(red or white), 1/2 tsp dried Greek oregano, 150g feta cheese, 8 black olives, olive oil, red vinegar, salt, some caper
Directions: First prepare the vegetables.  Cut up tomatoes into wedges, cucumber into thick slices and thinly slice the onion.  Place the vegetables into a bowl, then add the cubes of feta cheese, olives, oregano, and optionally, capers.  Season with salt, to taste, and pour over with olive oil.
